Description: Bell-shaped pendant: of wood with a loop at the top for suspension. Its fluted outer casing has split away from the central core and in some places has curled up and broken away completely.
Findspot: Found/Acquired: Mostagedda, Grave 761 Found in a child's burial
Curator's comments: Also from this burial: beads (1929,1015.512), pendant (1929,1015.511). Bibliography: G. Brunton, ‘Mostagedda and the Tasian Culture’ (London, 1937), pl.LV, group 2; Tomb register, pl.XLVIII; Bead register, pl.XLIXA; Bead corpus, pl.LVIII, 89G15.
Bibliographic references: Andrews 1981 / Catalogue of Egyptian Antiquities. Jewellery I (355)
